....</br>And now to charm our gracious Q— and K—,</br>Ascending on a public stage,</br>The tuneful wonder of the age,</br>Hight Incledon, arose to sing.
Of war he chaunted — glorious war,</br>Of millions, millions, sent afar,</br>To aid of falling Monarchy the cause;</br>When, lo!  the lofty Great all smiled applause.

Of taxes now the great Musician sung—</br>The Court, the chorus join'd,</br>And fill'd the wond'ring wind;</br>And taxes, taxes, through the garden rung.</br>Monarchs first of taxes think:</br>Taxes are the Monarch's treasure:</br>"Sweet the pleasure,</br>Rich the treasure,"</br>Monarchs love a guinea's chink.

And now to Avarice he tun'd the strain,</br>That suck'd a Nation like a spunge—</br>And now to Dissipation's madding train,</br>Who in distress a People plunge.</br>Now to poor FRANCE his plaintive voice he tun'd—</br>When mark!  the melting AUDIENCE almost swoon'd!

The SONGSTER now a graver subject chose—</br>"Who is to pay performers that compose</br>This charming Fete FROGMORE?" were the words:</br>With much surprise,</br>And rolling eyes,</br>FOLKS heard the syllables, that stabb'd like swords;

Now voices came — "Mine Gote! — enuff, enuff."—</br>"How!  how!  what, what?  stuff, Incledon, stuff, stuff."</br>"We pay!  no, no!  mine Gote, we haf more wit."—</br>Go, go to Parliament — ask PITT, ask PITT."

With loaded subject, ah!  we see</br>A Jack-ass in the next degree;</br>When soon appear'd the emblematic brutes,</br>With chimney sweepers on their backs</br>That kick'd, and spurr'd, and lash'd their backs—</br>And well with such tame souls the treatment suits.</br>Off gallop'd, for royal amusement the Asses;</br>'Mid the Haycocks they scamper'd, and knock'd down the lasses—</br>Girls squall'd, the Court laugh'd, and the Jack-asses bray'd</br>At the sight of the legs by the tumble display'd.</br>A COUPLE leaped down from their state to the PRANCERS,</br>MUSICIANS and RACERS, TUNE-GRINDERS and DANCERS;</br>Shook all by the hand, who, in compliment clever,</br>Roar'd aloud, "Kings and Queens, Fun and Frogmore for ever!!!"</br>
